intro: Distimake glaber, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of rough, hairy leaves and a single, elongated stem that supports a yellow composite flower head. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides. Its flowers produce small, wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution. Distimake glaber is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
